meanings.definition: To set a new price for something.
meanings.sent1: I will reprice the old books in the store.
meanings.sent2: The store decided to reprice the items for the sale.
meanings.sent3: Why did the comedian reprice the bananas? To make them a-peeling!
meanings.sent4: She repriced her services, making them more valuable than gold.
meanings.sent5: The magician's wand could reprice anything it touched.

meanings.definition: To change the price of something.
meanings.sent1: The company will reprice the products to attract more customers.
meanings.sent2: It is common for businesses to reprice their products based on demand.
meanings.sent3: The aliens threatened to reprice the Earth's resources with astronomical prices.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to reprice the value of happiness itself.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush could reprice reality into a masterpiece.
